DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety reactogenicity live attenuate influenza H5 vaccine candidate strain A/17/turkey/Turkey/05/133 ( H5N2 ) manufacture GPO , Thailand previously healthy Thais .
DOC.brief_title: Phase I Safety Immunogenicity Live Attenuated Influenza H5 Candidate Vaccine Strain A/17/Turkey/Turkey/05/133 ( H5N2 ) Healthy Thai Volunteers
DOC.detailed_description: It phase I randomize placebo control trial ( vaccine placebo ratio 2:1 ) . A phase II study plan conduct follow review result phase . Phase I : It double blind randomized placebo control trial involve 24 participant age 18-49 year ( 16 receive vaccine 8 receive placebo ) . All admitted isolation ward 10-14 day immunization mainly safety assessment . Two dos live attenuate influenza H5 vaccine candidate strain A/17/turkey/Turkey/05/133 ( H5N2 ) give intranasal route 21 day apart . Each group 4 participant immunized time 30-60 min interval . All participant follow 21 day immunization . Total follow 60 day .
DOC.criteria: Healthy Age 1849 year old Having Thai ID card equivalent Are seronegative specific H5 influenza virus determine antibody titer le 1:40 HAI test correspond antigen . Anti HIV Negative All hematology & biochemistry urine analysis within normal range clinical significance ( 1.5 time normal value ) Able read write sign write informed consent . Known history egg allergy Having recently influenza infection confirm H5 History bronchial asthma History chronic lung diseases History chronic rhinitis History immunodeficiency state History immunosuppression History heavy smoking ( 5 roll per day ) History alcoholic ( pure drink 200 ml per day ) Acute infectious noninfectious disease ( within 2 week ) Exacerbation chronic disease cancer HIV positives Anamnestic leukocytosis , hepatitis B C positives The volunteer take immunoglobulin product blood transfusion past three month begin experiment Participation research study stop participant le 1 month Pregnancy plan become pregnant 60 day enrollment breast feed Any concomitant medication Aspirin The volunteer family member immunodeficiency Poultry worker Have undertake international travel within one week prior immunization
